intro: Tylophora anfracta, commonly known as the twisted tylophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds with silky hairs. Tylophora anfracta is often found in tropical forests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
